intro: Ilex szechwanensis var. heterophylla, commonly known as the Sichuan holly, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its elliptical to ovate leaves that vary in size and shape, giving it its varietal name "heterophylla." The plant produces small, white flowers in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it suitable for ornamental gardening. Its unique foliage and seasonal color changes make it a notable species in botanical collections.
